raw_text:
US charity anthem is re-released
 
 We Are The World, the American charity anthem inspired by the success of Band Aid, has been re-issued to raise money for Aids research and tsunami victims.
 
 More than 40 stars sang as group USA For Africa, including Lionel Richie, Diana Ross, Ray Charles, Bob Dylan, Michael Jackson and Bruce Springsteen. It topped the charts in the US and UK, raising millions of dollars for African famine relief. The re-release also marks the 20th anniversary of the original recording. It has been re-issued as part of a two-disc DVD set, which will also feature footage from the recording session of the track in January 1985. The single was originally released in the US on 7 March 1985 and sold 800,000 copies in its first week. It went on to win Grammys for song of the year and record of the year.

It topped charts in US and UK, raising millions for famine relief. Originally released on March 7, 1985, it has sold over 800,000 copies. The re-release marks the 20th anniversary of the original recording and includes a two-disc DVD with footage from its 1985 recording session.
opencoder:1.5b: We Are The World has a major success story with a significant impact on African society through donations towards aid programs and victims from tsunamis. The album was also re-released as part of a two-disc DVD set, featuring footage from the recording session in January 1985. It sold over 800,000 copies worldwide and won Grammys for Song of the Year and Record of the Year. The release marks the 20th anniversary of its original recording.
smollm:1.7b: The re-release of "We Are The World" is a charity anthem that was inspired by the success of Band Aid, which raised money for Aids research and tsunami victims. The original recording was released in the US on 7 March 1985 and sold 800,000 copies in its first week. It topped the charts in both the US and UK and raised millions of dollars for African famine relief. The re-issue also marks the 20th anniversary of the original recording. It has been re-issued as part of a two-disc DVD set, which will feature footage from the recording session of the track in January 1985.

<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about a charity anthem being re-released. The user wants only the summary in plain text without any explanations or formatting. Let me break down the key points.

First, it's about "US charity anthem." That's inspired by Band Aid and is aimed at raising funds for AIDS research and tsunami victims. Got that.

Next, more than 40 stars sang together as group USA For Africa. The performers include Lionel Richie, Diana Ross, Ray Charles, Bob Dylan, Michael Jackson, and Bruce Springsteen. That's a lot of iconic artists, so it must be a significant group effort.

The song was released on 7 March 1985 in the US and UK, topping charts with millions for aid work. It won Grammys. The re-release is now part of a two-disc DVD set from January 2006, adding more content from session footage of 1985.

Originally sold around 800,000 copies in its first week. It also won song of the year and record of the year awards. So, it's not just about the music but also about its impact on those affected.

Putting this all together, I need to make sure the summary captures all these points concisely without extra info. I should mention the inspiration from Band Aid, the artists involved, the purpose (AIDS and tsunamis), the original release details, the re-release details, the awards it won, and the inclusion of a DVD set. That covers everything without being too wordy.
</think>

The US charity anthem, inspired by "Band Aid," has been re-issued to support AIDS research and Tsunami victims. It features 40 stars from various artists including Lionel Richie, Diana Ross, Ray Charles, Bob Dylan, Michael Jackson, and Bruce Springsteen, who sang together as USA For Africa. The song was first released on 7 March 1985 in the US and UK, topping charts with millions raised for aid work. It won Grammys for Song of the Year and Record of the Year. Now part of a two-disc DVD set from 2006, it includes session footage from 1985. Originally sold around 800,000 copies in its first week.
tinyllama:1.1b: In a summary, "We Are The World" (re-release) by American charity anthem featuring 40 stars was re-issued to raise funds for Aids research and tsunami victims. The original recording has been remastered for its 20th anniversary and marked with footage from the recording session in January 1985, resulting in a two-disc DVD set. It became an instant hit and sold over 800,000 copies in the US within its first week of release. The charity anthem was inspired by the success of the Band Aid initiative and remains an important force for positive change to this day.

The re-release includes bonus content, such as a concert from the recording session, and will be available on two discs.

granite3.1-dense:2b: The classic charity anthem "We Are The World" by US group USA For Africa, featuring stars like Lionel Richie, Diana Ross, Ray Charles, Bob Dylan, Michael Jackson, and Bruce Springsteen, is being re-released.
